message.content: {"id": "4974", "title": "Bug 4974 Set classpath / output location should be one operation", "description": "", "OB": "When the user presses 'Ok' after setting the output location, they receive the error message: 'Cannot nest output folder /xy in source folder /xy/src'. The problem is that setting the output location and classpath are currently treated as two separate operations. By setting the output location first, an illegal state is created.", "EB": "Bug 4974 Set classpath / output location should be one operation. Similar to the validation process that checks the classpath and output location at once, the setting of classpath and output location should be offered as a single operation. Please note that the error message appears to be incorrect. It should state that '/xy/src' cannot be nested in '/xy'.", "SR": ""}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '4974', 'title': 'Bug 4974Set classpath / output location should be one operation', 'description': '', 'OB': "Press OkYou get the error message:'Cannot nest outputfolder /xy in source folder /xy/src'The problem is that setting outputlocation and classpath are two operations.By setting the first, an illegal state is created. ", 'EB': "Bug 4974Set classpath / output location should be one operation Like the validation (checking classpath and outputlocation at once), thesetting of classpath / output location should be offered as one operation.Note that the error message is strange. I guess it should say: '/xy/src' cannot be nested in '/xy' ", 'SR': ''}
